text: I took a picture of a lot of the cities
of the world and one was a Berlin at
night
there were two different colors and when
I thought about it I realized the
streetlights of Berlin on one side are
one type of light and the other side
another which even from space showed up
as different colors and it was such a
poignant reminder of the history of
Berlin of a lack of freedom of an actual
wall dividing a city in half a wall that
has long since gone but the lingering
echo of freedom
astronauts have the incredible privilege
of circling the entire world over and
over again I used a lot of the time up
there to try and record daily life to
show people what it's like to live
without gravity even to the point of
recording music
freedom is the absolute ability to
choose and you don't really appreciate
freedom until it's gone and so to have
silently mutely broadcasting to the
universe a lingering echo of a freedom
that has been regained to me was was
really poetic and I was delighted to be
able to see it from orbit
